result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sherman Curtis Banks

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sherman Curtis Banks in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. On motion of the state, Court ordered case DISMISSED, but to be read in for the purpose of sentencing. jks

Defendant Sherman Curtis Banks in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense just received Discovery and would like to discuss the case further with defendant.  Defense requests a status date.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 46. jks
  Status conference scheduled for 02-09-2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KATHERINE C.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Sherman Curtis Banks in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Sherman Curtis Banks in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for January 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
